content: By: Christopher Long September 21, 2021 The Ultimate Guide to Digital PR Link Building | Content Marketing | Public Relations The team at Go Fish Digital shares their strategies for building links through digital PR. Read this post By: MacKenzie Hawe August 11, 2021 How to Choose Pillar Page Topics Content Marketing | On-page SEO With the growth of conversational search intent, pillar page strategies have entered the scene to fulfill those queries. Like anything in the SEO space, pillar page strategies take time and a great deal of planning to do correctly. Let’s break down this process. Read this post By: Rebekah Conway August 4, 2021 How to Carry Out Content Audits — Yes, Plural Content Marketing | On-page SEO | SEO Basics A content audit done once to highlight current website issues will have a short shelf-life of usefulness. However, a content audit that is continuously updated offers multiple uses for analyzing and reporting on strategies. Here’s how to conduct that ongoing audit. Read this post By: Chris Giarratana July 27, 2021 3 Powerful On-Page Optimizations to Power Up Your Content Content Marketing | On-page SEO | SEO Basics It’s not easy to write content that ranks in Google and drives conversions, but if you follow a few simple steps, you’ll be well on your way to ranking, and to engaging customers on all types of devices. Read this post By: Rhianna Hixon July 26, 2021 How to Use SERP Features to Inform Your Content Strategy Search Engines | Content Marketing With a little digging, you can now mimic the keyword topics, style, and format of the SERP features for your target keywords, creating content that engages your audience exactly where they are in the buyer’s journey. Read this post By: Sam O'Brien July 20, 2021 How to Create Cornerstone Content That Google and Your Audience Will Love Content Marketing | SEO Basics Read on for tips on creating, optimizing, and promoting the necessary, foundational content that drives traffic to your website, and that will eventually convert visitors into loyal customers. Read this post By: Miriam Ellis July 19, 2021 How to Create Your Local Business USP with QUAAAC + UGC Local SEO | Content Marketing | Branding In this article, Miriam helps you practice writing unique selling propositions (USPs) for real-world local businesses based on six simple components. Read this post By: Carly Schoonhoven July 2, 2021 A Step-by-Step Strategy for B2B Pillar Pages Whiteboard Friday | On-page SEO | Content Marketing A great way for B2B companies to fill a top-of-funnel content gap is by creating pillar pages. To help get you started, guest host Carly Schoonhoven of Obility walks you through a simple strategy for implementing pillar pages on your website. Read this post By: Amanda Milligan June 18, 2021 How to Make Newsworthy Content Content Marketing | Whiteboard Friday | Public Relations Ahead of her MozCon Virtual 2021 presentation, Amanda Milligan shows you what it takes to make your content newsworthy, in order to attract links. Read this post By: Hayley Bowyer May 19, 2021 MozCon Virtual 2021 Interview Series: Ross Simmonds SEO Events | Marketing Industry | Content Marketing We're absolutely thrilled to welcome Ross back to the MozCon stage, and we connected with him ahead of the show to discuss how he broke into the industry, his content philosophy, and what he’s looking forward to at MozCon 2021. Read this post By: Amanda Milligan April 29, 2021 How to Use Surveys to Tap into Trending Conversations (and Build Links) Content Marketing | Marketing Industry | Link Building Most brands aren’t operating full newsrooms and don’t have the capacity to cover breaking news, but there are still ways to participate in relevant, newsworthy conversations — and surveys are a great option. See how you can utilize surveys to add value to conversations, and earn the interest of writers at top publications. Read this post By: Adriana Stein April 15, 2021 How to Use Low Search Volume Keywords to Optimize B2B Tech Content Keyword Research | On-page SEO | Content Marketing For competitive niches, small addressable markets, or both, turn to this proven approach when trying to grow targeted organic traffic and brand awareness: targeting low search volume keywords. Read this post By: Victor Ijidola April 13, 2021 7 Questions to Ask When Hiring a Content Marketing Agency Content Marketing | Digital Marketing Agencies Deciding on an agency for content marketing is often tough thanks to the sheer volume of agencies out there, and because you want to ensure that the one you pick delivers ROI. To make things easier, here are seven key questions to ask when you’re trying to find the right agency for your content needs. Read this post By: Domenica D'Ottavio April 8, 2021 Earn Press Coverage for Your Brand in 5 Steps [Case Study] Content Marketing | Link Building | Public Relations In this post, Domenica shows you how her team at Fractl earned top-tier press coverage and backlinks for a client in five simple steps, and how you can apply these same steps to your own brand's content.
